metadata.title: CVE-2021-29974 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - medium.
metadata.description: When network partitioning was enabled, e.g. as a result of Enhanced Tracking Protection settings, a TLS error page would allow the user to override an error on a domain which had specified HTTP Strict Transport Security (which implies that the error should not be override-able.) This issue did not affect the network connections, and they were correctly upgraded to HTTPS automatically. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 90.

notes.note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in hirsute was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '90.0+build1-0ubuntu0.21.04.1').
mozjs78 package in hirsute is affected and may need fixing.
